events.name: Friday Hacks #99: Monadic Parsers & Writing Programming Language Applications: C Worksheet Instrumentor
events.description:
We’re very happy to have two recent graduates of NUS School of Computing to speak at this week’s Friday Hacks about a very important programming language construct: the parser. Omer will be introducing what monads are and how you can use them to build parsers, while Richard will give an overview about his FYP that lets you parse and evaluate C code inline in vim.

Free pizza is served before the talks. 

# Monadic Parsers

In this talk, we’ll learn about how to write a programming language parser using a functional programming construct called monads.

It’ll be broken down into three steps:

1) Writing some simple functions to parse chars, numbers etc
2) Combining these simple parsers to make more complex parsers using higher order functions (bind)
3) Oh wow, we discovered monads!

Analogies from other languages will also be given to make the concept independent from Haskell.

The talk will be based off this paper: http://www.cs.uwyo.edu/~jlc/courses/3015/parser_pearl.pdf

## Speaker profile
Omer is an NUS Hackers alumnus, currently working as an iOS Software Engineer at Garena. He also moonlights as a Haskell proselytizer, and is a little obsessed with writing useless, toy compilers.

# Writing Programming Language Applications: C Worksheet Instrumentor

My FYP has been described as “pretty cool”, “more useful than my FYP”, and “the best thing to ever happen to C”. - A C ‘worksheet’ program providing live-coding features that are becoming more common thanks to editors such as the LightTable (which gained 300K in its KickStarter). See https://github.com/rgoulter/c-worksheet.vim

In this presentation, I’ll give a sketch as to how to write programs which take in other programs as input, and how these outline how these techniques were applied to write the C worksheet tool.

## Speaker Profile
Richard is a recent graduate of NUS’ School of Computing, (not as an exchange student). When he was in his first year as an undergrad he grew such an impressive beard that when he shaved it off none of his friends recognised him even though he was the only angmoh in most of his classes.

Our Sponsors

Friday Hacks is sponsored by the NUS Enterprise Center and the Infocomm Development Authority.

If you are looking to turn your ideas into a startup and would love some business support, feel free to get in touch with Agustiadi from NUS Enterprise: agustiadi@nus.edu.sg

events.name: TGIFHacks #39 - PayPal presents PCB Design w KiCAD
events.description:
Welcome back from the recess week! Hope you guys have had plenty of rest! 

This week, to curb your school blues, we are gonna have a guest speaker, a PayPal employee come down to give a talk on PCB Design using the program KiCAD! PCB is printed circuit board, and is a board that supports electronic components. 

Please download KiCAD here for the workshop! http://kicad-pcb.org/  You can visit the website to learn more about the program too!

PayPal is an international e-commerce business allowing payments and money transfers to be made through the Internet.

The speaker for the talk will be Mr. Shipeng Xu. Mr. Shipeng is a geek who loves programming and hardware design. In his free time he contributes to open source software/hardware projects frequently. He received his Masters' degree in Embedded Systems from NTU School of Computer Engineering in 2014. He is currently working in PayPal as a software Engineer.

Do come down and learn more about PayPal!

REFRESHMENTS PROVIDED WOOHOO!

See ya there!

events.name: Meteor Global Distributed Hackathon! - Singapore
events.description:
24 Hours. Hundreds of Meteor Devs around the World.  This distributed hackathon, taking place over the weekend of October 10th and 11th, will have chapters working out of our meetups all around the world, but you're also free to work from home or your favorite coffee shop with other developers from anywhere in the world. It'll be a great chance to work with fellow Meteorites, share awesome apps, and communicate with other meetup groups about Meteor. Whether you're an experienced Meteor developer or just looking to get started, we hope you can join us. JOIN THE SINGAPORE EVENT HERE ON THIS MEETUP Whether you have a team or you are looking to join one please come along to our Hackathon which will have the following schedule: Saturday Oct, 10 12:00 PM - For those that are interested we can meet for lunch to do some brainstorming/team formation/eat lunch... Either the food court in Fusionoplis or one of the restaurants there... 1:00 PM - Participants arrive at venue (Block 71) and get set up  1:30 PM - People with ideas pitch the rest of the group to recruit members 2:00 PM - Hangout with other cities to discuss the projects you'll be working on 2:30 PM - Begin hacking  Get some sleep; you'll program much better! Sunday Oct, 11 1:00 PM - Organizer reminds people to finish testing and deploying 2:30 PM - End hacking ; organizer invites people to record 1 minute videos 3:00 PM - Project local videos 3:30 PM - Invite participants to share their lessons learned, write blog posts, tweet etc... Discuss next meetup. 4:00 PM - Hit a nearby pub and celebrate! 



Special Offers during this Hackathon Kadira Normally, Hackathon apps are not built for performance. But what happens if your app gets popular and it can't handle the load? So, it's a good idea to look at the performance of your app from the start. But, you shouldn’t spend too much time on that. That's where we are going to help you:  * Free access to BulletProof Meteor - Learn what you need to know about Meteor and Performance. (You can complete the basic section in less than 3 hours, then continue as you need) * Free access to Meteor Explained - It's a good idea to learn what's really going inside Meteor. * Full access to Kadira APM. (Load test your app before submitting it - Kadira will help you) Meteor Toys Meteor Toys will be offering free access to their development tools during the hackathon. They will award free licenses to the winning teams of "Top Five Overall Submissions", and to three teams they select for "Most Interesting Use of ToyKit," the SDK for building your own Meteor Toys. For more details, click here.  Sandstorm.io   - Special offers Useful.io - Special offers 


Further (official) information: http://info.meteor.com/2015-hackathon
events.location: Heardable, Block 71, #01-17/18, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore

events.name: From the Endangered to the Sublime: Global Eco-systems
events.description:
From the Endangered to the Sublime: Global Eco-systems 
Saturday 10 October 2015
2pm to 5pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

From the Endangered to the Sublime: Global Eco-systems is a half-day Conversations event bringing together leading researchers, artists and scientists for a debate about the world around us and its rich and fragile biodiversity. 

As part of ArtScience Museum’s Art and Science of Sustainability season, this event will highlight a number of exciting areas of research, including marine science and environmental management. 

Noted speakers include Eric Valli, the photographer behind the breath-taking images of our exhibition: Living Yangtze for Swarovski Waterschool, as well as eminent scientists and researchers including Michael Aw, author, explorer and conservation photographer. The day will be hosted by Kevin Teng, Executive Director of Sustainability at Marina Bay Sands.

This event is part of ArtScience Museum’s Art and Science of Sustainability season which aims to create awareness about the environment through a series of sustainability-themed activities, talks and workshops.

This fantastic initiative also aims to reach out to children from underpriviledged backgrounds and bring Making to them. Stay tuned for details

events.name: Hyper Haze Hack - One day hackathon to beat the haze!
events.description:
Singapore’s Pollutant Standard Index (PSI) hit its highest point in two years recently, with many schools cancelling outdoor activities and people staying indoors. So we are looking to build novel and practical applications on the seasonal haze situation that blankets Singapore every year. We are bringing together developers, bloggers, environmental organizations and media associations in an unprecedented civic hack to enhance our media reporting and response to the haze through the use of data. KEY OBJECTIVES Participants in the one-day haze-a-thon, on October 13, will be challenged to develop solutions, tools, widgets or apps that will enhance media reporting and citizen's responses to the haze. Proposed solutions could address some of the following challenges:  ●Forecast weather movements●Deliver objective, trustworthy PSI figures●Send timely alerts to residents●Help citizens to take adequate decisions and actions●Improve public education Please remember to sign up on Eventbrite here hazehack.eventbrite.sg  


JOIN US FOR AFTER HACK SOCIAL DRINKS After the Hyper Haze Hack, join us for ONA's monthly social drinks just downstairs at The Bank Bar & Bistro. More details here.
events.location: Google Singapore, Level 29, Asia Square Tower 1, 8 Marina View Singapore 018960, Singapore

We can also provide time for lightning talks, so if you want to give a short (5 minutes) talk on something you're working on or find interesting, please speak up. Agenda • Team introduction • Python for Data Analysis - Shubham Goyal • iPython/Jupyter Notebook Widgets - Ivan Vanzaj • Lightning talks Looking forward to seeing you all there.  We are proud to partner with Strata+Hadoop Singapore, Dec 1-3. Save 20% with code UGPYDASG http://oreil.ly/SHWSG15UG

events.name: Draw your own caricature or draw yourself as a superhero
events.description:
Draw your own caricature or draw yourself as a superhero 
by Ivan Chew

Ivan will first demo how to draw a caricature or a portrait of a face. Participants will learn how to take a selfie or import their photo, create a caricature or simple sketch, by applying the use of Layers, Opacity settings, Brush/ pen tool, Image import and they will also learn the basics of drawing a human face, e.g. facial proportions.
Participants can download the free sketchbook app from Autodesk on the spot. Those who own Android Samsung devices may already have the app preinstalled.

By the end of 2 hrs worksop, participants will have practiced the basic features of a mobile digital art app, be able to create a digital art piece even if they do not have any art experience. All you need is to have basic knowledge of how to operate your phone or device.
Check out Ivan Chew's blog for more about him and his works

http://artistivanchew.tumblr.com/

Register Here
http://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-oct-meeting-2015-tickets-18902860966

events.name: Spatial Visualization and Analysis with R
events.description: Hello everyone, for our next session, we'll take a break from learning about data mining algorithms; Nielsen will be giving us a workshop on Spatial visualizations with R. Here is a short synopsis of the session (there will be a hands-on portion so do bring along your laptops with the pre-req packages). And yes, there will be food. Synopsis:With the growing volume of digitized spatial information available, knowledge of spatial visualization and analysis will be extremely useful skills to have for a data scientist. In this session, we will share some basic spatial visualization and analysis using R based on some of the work we do. The focus will be on the use of Leaflet (for R), one of the powerful libraries for interactive visualization of spatial data. We will also briefly mention a few useful libraries for spatial analysis, and provide a few examples related to the work we do.To make the hands-on session smoother, you may wish to install the following R libraries, as well as the following data set: • Leaflet: devtools::install_github("rstudio/leaflet") • rgdal (CRAN) • rgeos (CRAN) • Dengue data (select the SHP icon): http://data.gov.sg/Metadata/OneMapMetadata.aspx?id=DENGUE_CLUSTER&mid=209760&t=SPATIAL Speaker Bio:Chong Jie (CJ) joined the Nielsen Data Science Singapore Innovation group at the end of last year. Some projects he works on include:Store-matching,  Automation of stratification and sample selection,  Digital Advertisement Ratings, and e-Commerce. At Nielsen, he also had the opportunity to conceptualize and conduct an Introductory R course to provide a hands-on learning approach to associates who wish to pick up R.  Prior to joining Nielsen, CJ worked at the Ministry of Education (MOE) for 8 years, and in the last 4 years with MOE, he led a newly established Data Management Committee for a branch in the MOE headquarters, handling data maintenance, extraction and analysis for the branch.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Intro to User Experience
events.description: Today, we interact with technology more than ever before and our access to digital products and services designed to make our lives easier continues to rapidly increase. Users ultimately want digital experiences that minimize frustration and provide seamless interactions, so how can we more effectively anticipate and tackle the problems users might have online?  The answer: Good user experience design.  Join Experience Lead at Huge, Julie Kondo, for an Intro to UX that will define what user experience design is, how it impacts your daily life, and how good UX design can completely transform experiences for the better. Julie will also cover valuable tips like how to get started in UX and how to build a good UX portfolio. About the Speaker: Julie Kondo, Experience Lead at Huge As a UX designer, Julie Kondo’s job is to help brands build digital products their customers will love. Specializing in service design, Julie has worked with large-scale international companies including Google, Toyota and Disney build experiences that reach millions of customers daily. Over the past three years, Julie has worked at digital agency Huge, where she’s done stints in their New York, Los Angeles and Singapore offices. She is currently based in Singapore, where she leads the UX on one of the agency’s largest accounts and helps grow Huge’s UX talent in the region. Prior to joining Huge, Julie was a Product Developer at Nickelodeon, where she focused on designing mobile apps and building prototypes.
events.location: Huge Singapore, 33 Ann Siang Rd, Suite 31A

Whether you're in government, academia, or the private sector, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you're in operations, development, QA, security, or any other department, DevOpsDays is for you. events.name: Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
events.description:
Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
17-18 Oct, Sat to Sun, 10am to 6pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

As part of Sunday Showcase, The Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab presents imaginative ways to engage the public in envisioning the future of technology and a Smart Nation. An invited group of participants across art, design and technology will work together to imagine what the future for a Smart Nation could entail. Involving narrative scenarios, critical thinking, participatory art and rapid prototyping, this showcase will aim to produce unique, creative perspectives on the developing landscape evolving around new technology. 

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
events.description:
FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
Saturday 17 October
10.15am -7.00pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

What is a smart nation, and what does it mean to be a smart citizen? How are artists, designers, futurists and civic innovators playing with the technology that is weaving itself into the fabric of our cities, economies and infrastructure? In partnership with ArtScience Museum, FutureEverything’s first ground-breaking conference in Singapore will look at how life, work and play have been fundamentally transformed by technology, and will form part of a national conversation in Singapore on the place of smart technology in society and culture. Noted speakers include critical futurist Scott Smith, designer and Internet of Things expert Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino, technology critic and fellow of Harvard’s Berkman Institute Sara Watson, lead strategist for globalfutures agenda Cheryl Chung, Nanyang Technical Institutes’ Andrea Nanetti, and the team behind Hello Lamppost, PAN Studios.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

More details here:  http://futureeverything.org/

events.description: Is Node.js the future of Java/Spring? Thibault Weintraub has already presented for us back in December last year. We had interviewed him here. In addition to be a great Java programmer, he is also a secret fan of Node.JS.Thibault will take us a side by side comparison between Java/Spring and Node.JS. As you will see, not everything should be done with Node.JS. But there are some situations in which it is much easier to use than Java.

events.name: iOS Ladies Workshop #1: Swift for Beginners
events.description: Swift is the elegant, simple, easy and powerful new language that Apple introduced last year. It can be used to create applications for iPhone, iPad, Mac desktops/laptops, and the Apple Watch.  In this introductory session for women, you will learn about the tools to build an iPhone app, the basics of the Swift programming language and get to build your 1st iOS app. You will also hear some lightning talks from local and international iOS developers who will be speaking at the first iOS Conference in Singapore. To get the most out of this workshop, you must have a Mac with Xcode 7 installed. You can download and install Xcode for FREE. https://developer.apple.com/xcode/. Make sure to install it prior to the session as the file is pretty big.  If you don't have a Mac then you can pair with someone at the event. Agenda06:30PM: Registration and Dinner (Pizza is provided!)07:00PM: Introduction to Xcode and Storyboard07:45PM: Hands-on Excercises. Familiarize yourself with the Tools and Components.08:15PM: Lightning Talk #108:20PM: Let’s learn about Swift 2.0!09:05PM: Lightning Talk #209:10PM: Time to build some apps! You will try your hands on building your personal PSI haze app.09:55PM: Quick revision + Next steps FAQsWhat should I bring?A Mac laptop and power supply. How do I check what version of Xcode I currently have?Checking your current version of Xcode is easy! Simply open Xcode, click on ‘Xcode’ on the top bar and select ‘About Xcode’. You should see a pop out that will tell you what version of Xcode you have. Is this free?Yes, absolutely free! We are committed to introduce more women to programming. Can I come if I'm not a woman?iOS Ladies is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit?Nope! Event is full! What should I do?Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional iOS Developer, can I be a coach?Yes, we are always looking for iOS experts to help! Please contact Elisha at [masked] and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches:- --
events.location: Paypal at Suntec , 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Business 365 Saturday | Singapore
events.description: October 24, 2015 This is the event to attend in 2015 for in-depth insights from world leading experts in the areas of SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365 and Office. Whether you are looking for technical knowledge, architectural approaches, or business strategy, this is where you will find your answers. We expect to have 15 topic sessions covering all aspects of SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365, and Office 2016. This Business 365 Saturday is a unique event because it is absolutely free, anyone can attend, it won't interfere with your work schedule, and it's planned with a community focus in mind. We bring the experts, consultants, and Microsoft MVPs from around the country to share their experiences, tips, and best practices. You won't get a day of sales pitches, instead you will receive training and the opportunity to network with other users. This is a great opportunity for you to meet other Microsoft professionals in the Singapore community, ask questions, network, and share your experiences. We expect a variety of educational sessions for: • End Users • Power Users • SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365 Administrators • Developers • Project Managers • Architects • IT Strategists & Executives For detail agenda please visit our website http://business365.azurewebsites.net
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Virtual Reality TL;DR with OSVR Demo
events.description:
For this meetup, we expect guests from OSVR (Open Source Virtual Reality) with their high end Hacker Kit. You can be one of the first in Singapore, who will try it. Have you ever come across something new in VR but you don't have the HMD for it? Or you want to create something for VR but you can't find someone to work together with? Use this event to collaborate and find out more about VR websites, videos, games and apps. We will break the participants in groups and you guys decide what you guys want to do. VR TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop for the event. Please install the VR games, apps or sdk that you are interested to share or work on before the event. After that, each group will share what they learned, tried or build. You guys can bring your VR input/output too. Please let us know. We will put it on the list. Expected VR input output. Oculus Rift DK2 x 1 Real Sense x 1 Kinect windows x 1 Structure io 3d scanner x 1 cardboard x 4 Agenda 7.15 pm - OSVR intro - Marquis, Dev Relations from Razer, OSVR 7.30 pm - R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 9.30 pm - Q&A: share what your team learned 





In Partnership with
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Hackware v1.2
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Our talks typically include side projects by speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things, radio frequency and much more! Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. (10min) Homemade HEPA Air Filter - Xong Sing Yap

2. (20min) FPGA: The basics - Brahim Hamadicharef
Prelude to the FPGA.SG v0.1 Meeting / Workshop October 2015

3. (20min) TBC

4. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

5. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

Sponsors:
events.location: General Assembly Singapore, The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik Road, Level 3, Singapore 089101 (Turn left on the side lane beside Lollapalooza and walk up to level 3)

events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #5: Watson
events.description: TBA: Something to do with Watson!!!
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Inaugural meetup and showcase
events.description: Inaugural meetup in the heart of Singapore. Showcase of exciting use cases with Yii framework. Pizza and drinks
events.group_name: Singapore PHP and Yii Framework Meetup

events.name: SARTS Monthly Meeting - October 2015
events.description: This is our regular monthly meeting, join us to learn more about Amateur Radio and our activities!

events.name: FPGA.SG v0.1 Meeting / Workshop October 2015
events.description: This will our first FPGA.SG Meeting / Workshop. Plan is to introduce FPGA topic, programming tool and language, development board, and spend the afternoon going through some tutorials and demos, and lot of discussions.

events.name: Bike building workshop
events.description: Do you remember the wacky and fun upcycled bikes at Maker Faire Singapore? Well, Mo and his team from Bikes4Fun will be joining us to facilitate a parent - child bicycle building workshop

events.name: Sense and Sensuality: The Art & Aesthetics of Wearable Technology
events.description:
Sense and Sensuality: The Art & Aesthetics of Wearable Technology
31 Oct- 1 November, Sat to Sun, 10am to 7pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

Sense and Sensuality celebrates new creative approaches that bring artists and designers together with engineers, scientists, and scholars from other fields. This showcase examines how technology is being used to interact with our body, cultures and surroundings, and engage our senses and expand our sensibility. Artists participating in this exhibition comprise faculty, students and alumni from ADM. The showcase is divided into five areas including craft, form, function, expression, and dimension in relation to technology.
Official fringe event of Digital Fashion Week Singapore 2015

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!

events.name: Fabric Hacking with Adafruit Flora
events.description: A collaboration with volunteers from Microsoft, as part of the Code for Change programme, Fabric Hacking with Adafruit Flora explores how you can light up your T Shirt or hat. Lets get together for a Halloween themed fun fiesta. Stay tuned for details

events.name: Dream Brewery Hackathon
events.description:
This is a partner's event organised by AngelHack. 


The love for beer and its craft has been around for ages but nothing has changed much since. Here’s a crazy idea for you. What would happen if we apply technology to this classic drink? Come hack 3 challenges with ABInBev at the Dream Brewery Hackathon on November 7th & 8th and stand a chance to win cash prizes, cool toys & even mentorship support to revolutionise the F&B space! Use “Free4Hack” @ http://Bitly.com/dreambreweryhackathon to get FREE tickets to the hack! 


For interested individuals / teams, please register at the link above to get your free tickets. Registration in meetup.com is not valid for this event.

events.name: Learn Chef Configuration Management Part 1
events.description: ** Had to bump this due to logistics and availability **The future of management and configuration of the Microsoft platform is Desired State Configuration. Chef is a configuration management product that is fully leveraging the DSC platform is important to the DevOps movement. There is some great content at learnchef.io which I have wanted to go through for a while but have yet to schedule in. So I am scheduling the time to do it.If you would like to Learn Chef too, join me for this Meetup. I cannot provide any expertise on Chef whatsoever, but I can provide a room with a big screen, food, uninterrupted time to watch the content and go through the labs as well as others to discuss with and expertise on DSC.If this sounds like something you'd like to do please come along, let's learn Chef and progress our journey to DevOps.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 13th Nov 2015 7:00pm
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Making things Move
events.description: Make things that twist, turn, pop and move. Parents and children can get hands on together and learn tinkering skills, science and art in this fun workshop.

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!

events.name: Maker Immersion Camp 2015
events.description:
Here is a chance for students aged 10-14 to collaborate for Maker Camp 2015. 

Learn: Woodworking, microcontrollers, Programming, Electronics, Fabric Hacking, Design thinking. 

Soft skills: Testing, tinkering, project design, teamwork, collaboration
